snippet: The sale of its snacks division and cost-cutting increased Procter’s earnings.
abstract: Procter & Gamble reports that its net income rose to $3.63 billion in its fourth fiscal quarter, up from $2.51 billion in the same period a year earlier; increase was helped by the sale of the company's snacks division.
lead_paragraph: The sale of its snacks division and cost-cutting increased Procter’s earnings.

headline.seo: Procter & Gamble’s Profits Rise on Snack Unit Sale
headline.main: Procter & Gamble’s Quarterly Profits Rise on Sale of Snack Unit
headline.print_headline: Procter & Gamble’s Quarterly Profits Rise on Sale of Snack Unit
